snippet: The grace period for a 2004 law prohibiting sales has ended, and while most eateries appear to be compliant, some serve the fattened duck or goose liver for free with other dishes.
abstract: Some California restaurants are finding clever ways to skirt state's 2004 ban on foie gras; most restaurants, however, have taken the dish off the menu while they await the outcome of two separate attempts at overturning the ban.
lead_paragraph: The grace period for a 2004 law prohibiting sales has ended, and while most eateries appear to be compliant, some serve the fattened duck or goose liver for free with other dishes.

headline.seo: Some California Restaurants Skirt Foie Gras Ban
headline.main: Some in California Skirt a Ban on Foie Gras
headline.print_headline: Some in California Skirt a Ban on Foie Gras
